channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Federal judge strikes down Trump order targeting the law firm Perkins Coie
item.description: The ruling from U.S. District Judge Beryl Howell is the first to permanently block an executive order issued by President Trump punishing a law firm f...

item.title: Australians vote in election, with high prices and housing shortage major issues
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's center-left Labor Party is seeking a second term. His opponent, conservative opposition leader Peter Dutton, wants t...

item.title: The Trump administration says it will cut EPA staffing to Reagan-era levels
item.description: EPA announced plans to reorganize the agency, moving science-focused staff into different roles and reducing the overall number of employees.

item.title: Brazil social security minister latest to quit in major pension fraud scandal
item.description: The scheme allegedly saw pensioners defrauded of payments, with the diverted money shared among corrupt officials.

item.title: 'I saved my ID card and my dog': Israel expands demolitions of West Bank refugee homes
item.description: Jumaa Zawayda didn't know if his home was among those destroyed after Israel ordered thousands to evacuate Jenin.

item.title: Denver oldest serving fire station home to first Black firefighters
item.description: Serving the community meant clearing racial hurdles. And sometimes entailed paying the highest price in the line of duty.

item.title: Iranian students at the University of Alabama say immigration crackdown echoes repression at home
item.description: Alireza Doroudi has been detained in an immigration facility in Louisiana for nearly six weeks. Doroudi’s detention has instilled fear in the small Ir...

item.title: India and Pakistan are in crisis again - here's how they de-escalated in the past
item.description: The way events unfolded after the Pulwama bombing and Pahalgam killings is strikingly similar, says a former diplomat.

item.title: Pirates fan who fell over wall at PNC Park identified as young man who "made a lasting impact on the South Allegheny community"
item.description: Kavan Markwood is the fan​ who fell from the 21-foot Clemente Wall in right field at PNC Park in Pittsburgh on Wednesday.

item.title: 2 wounded in shooting at Spartan College in Inglewood; suspect in custody
item.description: Two of the victims were believed to be female employees of the college, Inglewood's mayor told CBS News Los Angeles.

item.title: Department of Justice suing Colorado, Denver over "sanctuary" policies
item.description: The Department of Justice has filed a lawsuit against the state of Colorado, the city of Denver and a list of local leaders.

item.title: Canada's Carney offers strategic invite to King ahead of Trump meeting
item.description: In his first news conference since the federal election, the PM laid out his approach to talks with his US counterpart.

item.title: 5/2: CBS Evening News
item.description: Diner owner feeling the pinch as costs rise and customers cut back; Hundreds form a human chain to move a Michigan bookstore by hand

item.title: Seven killed in tour bus crash near Yellowstone National Park
item.description: A pickup truck and a tourist van collide on a highway near the famous attraction in eastern Idaho.

item.title: Radio Free Asia announces mass layoffs amid funding fight with Trump administration
item.description: Radio Free Asia is laying off about 90 percent of its staff. It says it can no longer pay people after its funding was cut off by the Trump administra...

item.title: Man sentenced to 53 years in prison in attack on Palestinian American boy, mother
item.description: An Illinois landlord who killed a 6-year-old Muslim boy and severely injured the boy's mother in a brutal hate-crime attack days after the war in Gaza...

item.title: In the wake of devastating Los Angeles fires, residents begin to rebuild
NYPD shared a Palestinian protester’s info with ICE. Now it’s evidence in her deportation case
